intro: Geonoma brachyfoliata, commonly known as the short-leaved geonoma, is a species of fern native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as rainforests and understories. Its fronds are usually short and broad, with a dense, leathery texture. It plays a role in the ecological structure of its habitat by providing shelter and contributing to nutrient cycling.
